IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SINCE 1977 WE HAVE EMPOWERED COMMUNITY BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO ADVANCE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION. OUR PROGRAM AREAS INCLUDE CLIMATE AND ENERGY, OPEN SPACE AND WILDLIFE, CLEAN WATER AND SANTA BARBARA CHANNEL. WE PRIMARILY WORK WITHIN SANTA BARBARA, VENTURA AND SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTIES. EDC IS ORGANIZED AS A SEC. 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT CORPORATION, AND PROVIDES LEGAL COUNSEL TO OTHER NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. WE REMAIN THE ONLY SUCH PUBLIC INTEREST ENVIRONMENTAL LAW FIRM BETWEEN LOS ANGELES AND SAN FRANCISCO, AND THRIVE ON THE SUPPORT OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS FROM WITHIN OUR REGION AND BEYOND.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION PROTECTS AND ENHANCES THE LOCAL ENVIRONMENT THROUGH EDUCATION, ADVOCACY AND LEGAL ACTION.
IRS990.Desc: SANTA BARBARA CHANNEL (ISSUES REGARDING OCEAN WATER QUALITY, CHANNEL ISLANDS NATIONAL MARINE SANCTUARY, COASTAL DEVELOPMENT, OFFSHORE OIL AND GAS, PUBLIC ACCESS): EDC CHAIRS THE CINMS CONSERVATION WORKING GROUP AND RECEIVED A NATIONAL AWARD FROM NOAA FOR LEADERSHIP ON THE ISSUE OF OCEAN ACIDIFICATION.AND RECEIVED EPA NATIONAL CLEAN AIR EXCELLENCE AWARD. ACTIVE PARTICIPANT IN MLPA IMPLEMENTATION PLAN PROCESS. OBTAINED SETTLEMENT WITH NOAA TO PROTECT SEA OTTERS IN SANTA BARBARA CHANNEL. LEADS COALITION TO PROTECT BLUE WHALES FROM CARGO SHIP STRIKES. PROTECTING ORMAND BEACH WETLANDS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: OPEN SPACE AND WILDLIFE PRESERVATION: (ISSUES REGARDING ENDANGERED SPECIES, HABITATS, WATERSHEDS, AGRICULTURAL AND OPEN SPACE LANDS): OPEN-SPACE PRESERVATION AND EDUCATION NETWORK (OPEN) ACTIVELY PARTICIPATED IN GOLETA, GOLETA VALLEY, SANTA YNEZ, LOS ALAMOS, BUELLTON, AND GAVIOTA COMMUNITY PLANNING PROCESSES AS WELL AS LAND USE DEVELOPMENT CODE MODIFICATIONS. EDC PLAYED KEY ROLE IN INITIATING GAVIOTA PLANNING PROCESS AND SERVED ON GAVPAC. CONVENES AND CHAIRS GAVIOTA COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS ROUNDTABLE. PLAYS SIGNIFICANT ROLE IN MONITORING, ADVOCATING AND FACILITATING FOR STEELHEAD TROUT HABITAT RESTORATION. ATTORNEY FOR NAPLES PRESERVATION. PROTECTED CANADA LARGA, EAST AREA 1, BAILEY AVE. AG SITES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CLIMATE AND ENERGY (ISSUES REGARDING OIL AND GAS DEVELOPMENT, CARBON EMMISSIONS AND ADVOCACY FOR SUSTAINABILITY AND RENEWABLE ENERGY): FOUNDED AS RESPONSE TO 1969 SANTA BARBRA OIL SPILL. PLAYED LEADING ROLE IN RESPONSE AND MONITORING OF REFUGIO OIL SPILL. LEADS EFFORTS AGAINST FRACKING AND ACIDIZING OFF OUR COAST AND THE EXPANSION OF IRRESPONSIBLE OIL & GAS DEVELOPMENT INCLUDING CYCLIC STEAM INJECTION, HYDRAULIC FRACTURING (FRACKING) & ACID WELL STIMULATION (ACIDIZING) WITHIN OUR SERVICE AREA. WORKING TO PREVENT OIL TRAINS FROM TRANSIT ALONG CA COAST. WORKING TO PREVENT NEW OR EXPANDED OIL LEASES OFFSHORE. PREVENTED THREE SEPARATE ATTEMPTS TO IMPORT LIQUEFIED NATURAL GAS THROUGH OUR COAST. RETIRED FORTY OFFSHORE OIL LEASES. CHAIRS SANTA BARBARA ENVIRONMENTAL COALITION. CONTINUES TO MONITOR CLEAN-UP AND RESTORATION OF HALACO TOXIC SITE WHICH EDC SUED, LEADING TO THE CLOSING OF THE FACILITY, NOW A SUPERFUND SITE. ONGOING WORK TO ASSURE TOTAL MITIGATION OF GREENHOUSE GASES

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: CLEAN WATER (ISSUES REGARDING STORMWATER RUNOFF AND INDUSTRIAL POLUTION): PUBLISHED CLEAN WATER ACT ENFORCEMENT NOTICES, LITIGATION AND RESOLUTION. FOUNDED AG FUTURES ALLIANCE, AND OPEN SPACE PRESERVATION EDUCATIONAL NETWORK (OPEN) WHERE FARMERS, RANCHERS,FARM LABOR REPRESENTATIVES, ENVIRONMENTALISTS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS WORK TOGETHER TO PROPOSE COOPERATIVE MEASURES ON ISSUES OF MUTUAL CONCERN. WORKING TO DEFEND SANTA YNEZ RIVER, VENTURA RIVER, SANTA CLARA RIVER, SANTA MARIA RIVER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENDOWMENT FUNDS TO BE INVESTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INVESTMENT POLICY OF THE CORPORATION FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING CONSISTENT INCOME TO SUPPORT THE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS OF THE ORGANIZATION, AS DETERMINED APPROPRIATE BY THE BOARD.

THE CENTER IS EXEMPT FROM TAXES ON INCOME UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3) AND CALIFORNIA REVENUE AND TAXATION CODE 23701(D), THEREFORE NO AMOUNTS FOR INCOME TAXES ARE REFLECTED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE CENTER IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION FOR INCOME TAX PURPOSES. THE CENTER IS NOT AWARE OF ANY TRANSACTIONS THAT WOULD AFFECT ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS. THE CENTER EVALUATES UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS, WHEREBY THE EFFECT OF THE UNCERTAINTY WOULD BE RECORDED IF THE OUTCOME WAS CONSIDERED PROBABLE AND REASONABLY ESTIMABLE. AS OF MARCH 31,2018, THE CENTER HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS REQUIRING ACCRUAL. THE CENTER FILES TAX RETURNS IN CALIFORNIA AND U.S. FEDERAL JURISDICTIONS. THE CENTER IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2014 AND 2013, RESPECTIVELY.
COSTS OF DIRECT BENEFITS TO DONORS -25,265.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ONCE THERE IS A FINAL DRAFT SENT FOR REVIEW TO EDC, THE ACCOUNTING MANAGER (AM), EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR (ED) AND TREASURER ALL REVIEW IT. A DRAFT IS THEN CIRCULATED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR PROVIDES FINAL COPY OF THE FORM 990 TO BOARD MEMBERS BEFORE FILING WITH IRS AND SIGNS THE 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EDC HAS WEEKLY STAFF MEETINGS ATTENDED BY ALL EMPLOYEES. WE DISCUSS ANY AND ALL NEW CASES, CASE ACTIVITY, AND ISSUES OF POTENTIAL CONCERN. ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE RAISED AND DISCUSSED IN THESE MEETINGS. THE BOARD ALSO MONITORS DIRECTORS' COMPLIANCE TO THE CORPORATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, ANNUALLY EVALUATING DIRECTOR'S DISCLOSURES OF POTENTIAL CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, WITH INPUT FROM THE BOARD, REVIEWS THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR (ED)AND CHIEF COUNSEL'S (CC) PERFORMANCE. BASED UPON THE REVIEW, SALARY SURVEYS AND THE BUDGET, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE RECOMMENDS A COMPENSATION PACKAGE FOR THE ED AND CC TO THE BOARD THAT INCLUDES SALARY (AND BONUS, IF ANY). OTHER PARTS OF THE ED AND CC'S COMPENSATION PACKAGE SUCH AS PENSION AND HEALTH INSURANCE ARE THE SAME AS IS PROVIDED TO OTHER STAFF.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THESE DOCUMENTS ARE NOT GENERALLY AVAILABLE. A FINANCIAL SUMMARY IS PUBLISHED ON OUR WEBSITE. OTHERWISE, THE 990 IS PUBLICALLY AVAILABLE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 11D AND SCHEDULE C:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION INCURRED $5,224 IN LOBBYING COSTS IN 2017 AND THEY ARE REPORTED ON SCHEDULE C. THESE COSTS ARE NOT REPORTED ON PART IX, PAGE 10, LINE 11D SINCE NONE OF THE COSTS WERE PROFESSIONAL FEES.
